info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 11:55PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Norton County through 1230 AM CDT... At 1155 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Clayton, or 8 miles southwest of Norton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Norton County, including the following locations... Reager and New Almelo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
